tool_description: Constructs the kinematic chain model from joint parameters using Denavit-Hartenberg parameters for forward and inverse kinematics calculations.

joint_configs.description: Array of validated joint configuration strings

dh_a_params.description: DH a parameters (link lengths) in mm

dh_alpha_params.description: DH alpha parameters (link twists) in degrees

dh_d_params.description: DH d parameters (link offsets) in mm

dh_theta_params.description: DH theta parameters (joint angles) in degrees

base_position.description: Base position coordinates [x, y, z] in mm

base_orientation.description: Base orientation [roll, pitch, yaw] in degrees

tool_offset.description: Tool center point offset [x, y, z] in mm

error_messages: Parameter length mismatch: All DH parameter arrays must have the same length as joint_configs
Invalid DH parameters: Alpha values must be between -180 and 180 degrees
Invalid base configuration: Position and orientation arrays must have exactly 3 elements
Insufficient joints: Minimum 2 joints required for kinematic chain
Excessive joints: Maximum 10 joints supported for computational efficiency
usage: Provide joint configurations and corresponding DH parameters. Optionally specify base pose and tool offset. The tool builds a complete kinematic model for the robotic arm.

transformation_matrices.description: Array of transformation matrix strings for each joint

degrees_of_freedom.description: Total degrees of freedom for the arm
